Lawrenceville came into being on December 15, 1821 and is the county seat of
County, which was formed exactly 3 years prior. Lawrenceville was the second city founded in the greater
area. The location for the original town square was chosen due to its close proximity to multiple springs

. 
Lawrenceville was named after Captain James Lawrence who was commander of the frigate Chesapeake. During a battle with H. M. S Shannon on June 1, 1813, off the coast near Boston, Massachusetts captain Lawrence was mortally wounded. His dying words were, "Don't give up the ship."

In 1978 Larry Flynt, publisher of Hustler Magazine, was shot on the Lawrenceville courthouse square allegedly by Joseph Paul Franklin.
There is no regular passenger service into Lawrenceville but there is a large general aviation airport that charter flights can fly into. Gwinnett County's
has a 6,000 foot runway with two FBOs supplying both 100LL and Jet-A fuel.
is 40 miles southeast of Lawrenceville in
. There are several ways to get from Hartsfield-Jackson to Lawrenceville:

then head southeast on Sugarloaf Parkway.

taking exit 106 onto GA-316. Travel east on GA-316 to Highway 20 and turn right.

value: content=On the grounds of the Gwinnett Justice and Administration Center. +1 770 822-8000. 13 black granite markers immortalize Gwinnett residents who died in service to their country (both military and public safety service) as well as those who impacted American history, listing their names in no order and without rank.

content=Open Monday - Saturday 10AM - 4PM, closes at 2PM on Saturdays. Part of the National Register of Historic Places, the courthouse has erected in 1885. The exterior sports a clock tower and a turret with a balcony. The inside contains the Gwinnett Veterans Council War Memorial Museum open to self-guided tours. The courtyard and pavilion play host to weddings, the Annual Lighting of the Tree, and Moonlight and Music summer concerts.

content=Open Monday - Thursday, 10AM - 4PM. Registered in the National Register of Historic Places, the Gwinnett History Museum is hosted inside the Lawrenceville Female Seminary. One of the oldest buildings of Lawrenceville, the structure is over 150 years old.

800 Old Snellville Highway. +1 770 822-5414. Open sunrise until sunset. Alexander park includes a playground, a 1.4 mile multipurpose trail, a small fishing lake with piers, and an 18-hole disc golf course

. The playground was built within the last five years and has swings, a boulder structure, two large structures, and multiple slides. The disc golf course has a practice putting basket and 18 holes with both beginner and regular tees adding up to 56 par depending on the current basket pin positions. The course has a mix of wooded and open holes. There are 2 pavilions, one of which is equipped with a grill. This is a very well-maintained and new park spanning over 91 acres.
content=The Aurora is located in downtown Lawrenceville and hosts shows and plays every weekend as well as classes during the week. Shows are performed by local actors. Show times and prices vary.

585 Camp Perrin Road. +1 770 237-5647. Collins Hill Golf Club sports a driving range, pro shop, clubhouse, and 18-hole golf course. Non-resident walk-ins cost $35 a round or $29 if reserved online. There are many other cheaper rates depending on time, residency, and age
name=Collins Hill Park and Aquatics Center

content=Info/rentals: +1 678 277-0855. Aquatics Center: +1 770 237-5647. Open sunrise until 11PM. On over 95 acres, this park has a collection of seven baseball/softball fields, a football field, sand volleyball courts, playgrounds, 1.5 miles of trail, a fishing lake, and an aquatics center with an outdoor leisure pool and indoor competition pools. Entrance and parking are free.

content=Suite 441. Open Sunday - Thursday 11:30am - Midnight, Friday - Saturday 11:30am - 1:00am. Located in Sugarloaf Mills, D&B hosts a bar, grill, bowling alley, billiards room, and hundreds of arcade style games. Rates vary, budget around $25 for a day of games and food.
content=This park includes a large, modern playground, 0.5 miles of paved trail, and an intact historic mill.

content=Home of the Gwinnett Braves, Coolray field is a minor-league baseball field located north of downtown Lawrenceville towards I-85. Ticket prices range from $6 lawn seating to $170 anytime box tickets.

content=Boasts 46 county parks and facilities, several of which are in Lawrenceville (and all are within a short drive's range). Do not leave your car parked in any park past dark. Free admission to all parks.

. Medieval Times provides dinner and a show for the whole family. Admission includes an old-style chicken meal and a medieval themed performance that includes jousting and sword-fighting. Adult tickets are $51.95, child tickets are $35.95.
178 East Crogan Street Suite 230. +1 678 226-4970. Varying times with private booking available

. Here you can attend painting sessions in a relaxed studio. Visitors are encouraged to "bring your favorite people, munchies, bottle of wine or other favorite beverage" to be guided by artists and have a care-free painting session. Other events include family days, private parties, and days that benefit charity.
100 East Crogan Street. Gym/info: +1 678 277-0890. Pool: +1 678 277-0892. Pool hours

. Open sunrise until 11PM. Rhodes Jordan Park is over 162 acres and has 1.9 miles of multipurpose paved trail. There is a recreation center, gymnasium, indoor pool, outdoor aquatics park, seven baseball/softball fields, eight lit tennis courts, a football field, outdoor basketball court and large fishing lake. The playground and adjacent pavilion and grills was constructed in 2011 and is very large and well-maintained.

content=Tours begin at the Aurora Theatre, 128 Pike Street. +1 678 226-6222. Tours are every Friday and Saturday May through September at 8:30 PM. and every night in October at 7:30 PM. Explore Lawrenceville's haunted past on a ghost tour through downtown Lawrenceville. Adult tickets are $12, Children are $9.
http://webbgin.shoptheavenue.com/ The Avenue at Webb Gin
1350 Scenic Highway. +1 770 978-5692. The Avenue is a form of plaza/strip mall with a collection of eateries and stores
. Parking is free. Shopping and dining are moderately upscale.
) 5900 Sugarloaf Parkway, between Duluth Highway and I-85 (just off of Exit 108). +1 678 847-5000. The mall includes over 180 stores and kiosks as well as an
movie theater. The mall is structured in a loop with the food court linking to two parts in the middle. There is parking surrounding the mall as well as a parking deck; all parking is free.
3333 Buford Drive, just off of I-85 exit 115 and 8 miles north of Lawrenceville on Buford Highway/US-20. +1 678 482-5858. The Mall of Georgia has over 225 different stores, a large food court, and an
movie theater. There are stores on two stories inside the mall as well as many disconnected from the main complex. Parking surrounds the mall as well as a pay-to-park parking deck.

content=Closed on Saturday and Sunday, open Monday through Friday 7AM - 3PM (closed between 10AM and 11AM). Dinner is served on Fridays 5PM - 8PM. Southern Style Cookinâ€™ in The Heart of Historic Downtown Lawrenceville.
content=Fine Italian dining and full bar in a casual environment. Excellent and quick service. Every meal comes with the best rolls in Lawrenceville (

content=Lunch served Monday through Friday 11AM - 2PM. Dinner times vary, Monday - Thursday 5PM - 9:30PM, Friday 5PM - 10PM, Saturday 11AM - 10PM, Sunday 5PM - 9PM. Dominic's is an Upscale Italian restaurant located in the Rhodes Jordan building on the Courthouse Square in downtown. Dominic's serves lunch and dinner and has an extensive wine list. Free wi-fi is available. Entrees are about $15 - $25.
content=Family restaurant that serves Mexican-style food. $5.95 lunch combos, dinner is around $10.
content=An American classic fine dining restaurant with an extensive wine list.

. 60 East Pike Street, between Rhodes Jordan Park and Buford Highway/US-20. +1 770 962-1367. Breakfast served Monday through Saturday 5:30AM - 11AM, lunch from 11AM - 2PM. This excellent family-run restaurant is housed in a large red barn. Little Barn boasts its large biscuits, Brunswick stew, and classic Southern gravy and sweet tea (available for purchase by the gallon)
. Drive-thru and dine-in options. If the main parking lot is full, there is a gravel lot just above the main lot. Biscuits are around $2 each, barbeque sandwiches $3.
address=1154 Lawrenceville Highway/US-29, in a strip in the Ingles shopping center
hours=11AM - 10PM on weekdays, open until 11PM on Friday and Saturday. Sundays 12PM - 10PM

content= This franchise has a drive-thru as well as carry-out, but no dining area. The menu includes a collection of pizzas, bread-sticks, and wings. The service is sub-par regularly; ask for Ryan if you decide to go here. Hot-N-Ready pizzas are $5, specialty pizzas are about $8, wings are $6.

content=McCray's is a classic American sports bar and grill in downtown. Dining options include regular seating, booths, a bar, and tables on the roof that overlook the town square. Expect to pay around $20 to $30 for a full meal.

content=125B Crogan Street. Open 11AM - 10PM weekdays, until 11PM Friday and Saturday, and closing at 9 PM on Sundays. This is a Florida-style seafood and oyster restaurant and bar in downtown with a seaside bar vibe. Oysters are around $11 a dozen; budget around $20 per meal.
content=Peachtree Cafe serves breakfast foods such as Belgian Waffles as well as specialty burgers. Breakfast is about $5; dinner is around $10.

. 117 Perry Street. +1 770 807-3070. This little hole-in-the-wall (the restaurant is only about five feet wide with three tables) serves excellent Mediterranean food, including hummus, gyros, and grape leaves. Boasts a perfect 30/30 score on Google's Zagat

designates that establishments that serve alcohol must be primarily restaurants. There are no typical "bars" or "clubs" in Lawrenceville.

value: content=Offering free hot breakfast, free WiFi and free parking.

content=All-suites hotel with kitchens plus hot full breakfast, internet and conveniences, located off I-85 minutes from the Gwinnett Arena
